content: I think this is part of the problem: our perspective of the media as an “information landscape.” As you argue, people are not agents that process information and make decisions. Instead, they are individuals with bounded attention who are persuaded. Perhaps a better perspective would be to consider a persuasion/attention landscape. Facebook may be an ideal “information pasture”, lots of little bits of information that are great for foraging. But it is also a medium that slices attention thin, and has issues of confirmation bias.
